lines.text: Poor Faust, why do you seek death when you have not yet lived?
I hate life!
Your life was only dust and decay! Pleasure is everything!
I am too old!
Youth! Seize it!
Behold! The Gates of Hell are opened and the horrors of the masses plague the earth...
Get back! Halt! Why dost thou torture humanity with war, plague and famine?
The earth is mine!
His spirit strives for truth!
All things in heaven and on earth are wonderful! But the greatest miracle of all is man's freedom to choose between good and evil!
I'll wager that I shall wrest Faust's soul from God!
We know not when we shall meet death! Until then, let us eat, drink and be merry!
We are lost! Belief will not help you, nor shall knowledge! Everything is lies!
MEMPHISTO, appear!
Your wish is my command! You are the master, I am your servant!
A tiny drop of blood! Blood makes a quite extraordinary ink!
Deliver me, O elixir of death!
Every man is free to die!
Do you want a woman, a card game, an orgy?
A goody two-shoes, headed to the cleric... she's not your type... !
I know more obliging wenches for you here!
Once she has this little golden necklace in the house, she will feel the power of the devil!
Goodness gracious, how pretty you are! How's it going with the men?
Three drops of this love potion will make all women crazy for you!
A pretty girl is not well behaved! Long live Gretchen!
Don't touch me, you whore! Your lover has murdered me! First, give me last rites! Then to the stocks with this harlot!

[singing]
Earth and sky shall surely quake, when the dead themselves awake, answers to the Lord to take. When the court is held in sway, hiding shall no longer pay, all must out on Judgement Day!
Damn! Damn the delusion of youth!

[Last lines]
The word that rings joyfully throughout creation, the word that alleviates every pain and sorrow, the word that absolves all the guilt of humanity, the eternal word. Dost thou not know it?
What is the word?
Love
